author: Staff Reporter
text:
FOR BETTER FACILITIES:Residents of ward 30 laying siege to Dindigul Corporation office on Tuesday, condemning “erratic water supply” to their ward.— PHOTO: G. Karthikeyan

Residents of ward 30 in Dindigul Corporation laid siege to the Corporation office here on Tuesday, condemning “erratic supply of drinking water to their ward and inaction of the Corporation in providing basic amenities”.

They congregated before the office in the morning. Tirumalaisamypuram, Kakkan Nagar, Bodinayakkanpatti and Indira Nagar coming under the ward were worst affected they did not have basic infrastructure like drainage facilities and proper roads, the residents said, and demanded proper reply from officials.

The agitators also charged that drinking water was not supplied to them for the past 22 days. Drains were clogged and sewage water was stagnating on road.

Sanitary workers visited the area rarely, and pigs were moving about freely, they alleged.

“I have been raising these issues in the Corporation Council meeting for the past four and a half years. The corporation did not take any step to improve facilities in our ward,” said ward councillor S. Vijaya Kumar.

Later, Corporation Engineer Ganesan spoke to officials and assured the agitators that their grievances would be redressed soon.
title: Residents lay siege to Dindigul Corporation office
